Key Match Events: The Rangers scored early with two first-inning home runs from Semien and Nathaniel Lowe.
The Rangers tacked on late insurance — as has been their penchant lately — with two runs in the bottom of the eighth inning courtesy of a Travis Jankowski single and a Los Angeles error.
Pre-Game Insights: Andrew Heaney, on Aug. 21, when the Rangers were double-digit games under.500 and double-digit games back of first place in the American League West: “I’m hoping that guys will just kind of play loose and free at the end if we’re all just — I mean, I guess we’re not officially eliminated, right? Maybe we’ll go win some games.”
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Heaney, after a 7-4 win vs. the Los Angeles Angels at Globe Life Field that pulled the Rangers to within striking distance of a.500 record: “When you play well, the looseness happens. When you’re loose, the winning continues.”
Rangers manager Bruce Bochy said, “I think, overall, yeah, [this has been the Rangers' best stretch of baseball this season].”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers have won four consecutive series and have 10 wins in a 13-game stretch for the first time since last year.
The Rangers' 10-3 record in their last 13 games is the best in the American League.
Others: The wild card race — in which the Rangers trail Minnesota by 6½ games for the third and final berth — is suddenly a more realistic last-ditch initiative.
The remainder of this season is focused on next season for all intents and purposes anyways.
